body.p:
To His Excellency Govenor
Thomas. E. Bramlett

Your Petitioners would respectfully represent that George Williams a citizen of the County of Grant was indicted in the Grant Circuit Court for assault and battery and was at the Term of Said Court fined the Sum of $75 -- -- we would further represent that Said Williams is a verry old man and a verry poor One, not able to make His fine to the Commonwealth without great pecuniary embarrassment to Him, He has Served His Country well both in the war of 1812 and this present war, He was a Soldier in the 18th Ky Vol Inft, and descharged His duty faithfully until He was descharged in consequence of His great age advanced age and disability -- We believe in consideration of the above Circumstance His fine Should be remitted, we therefore hope Your Excellancy will favorably Consider this Petition and we will ever pray &., &, &

George ^his X mark^ Williams
J. J. Landram
P T Drim Pro. WmsTown
John. Marksbury sheriff Grant Co ^Ky^

I have known the above named George Williams ^for some years:^ he is an old man a soldier of the war of 1812, he is decriped & I think wholly incapable of haveing committed such an assault as he has been charged with -- He is poor & wholly unable to pay his fine. I pray it to be remitted
I have known George Williams for Some Considerable time and the facts in the Petition is literally true I believe and I hope You will favorably consider the same,

I have been acquainted with Mr. Geo. Williams for many years and know that the petition of is worthy of the consideration of your excellency, and trust you will remit the fine mentioned in the petition
B. N. Carter J. P. G. C

Grant Cir Ct
